title: Mahabharata: The History of Greater India | HDG Srila Prabhupada | Bg 2.1 | 05.08.2024
speaker: HDG Srila Prabhupada

segments.key_quote: Compassion for the eternal soul is real self-realization.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains the first verse of the second chapter of Bhagavad-gita, focusing on Arjuna's compassion and Krishna's role in dispelling ignorance.

segments.key_quote: That position is greater than to become one with Kṛṣṇa.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada describes the setup of the Bhagavad-gita and contrasts the desire to merge with Krishna with the devotee's desire to serve Krishna, highlighting the superior position of devotional service.

segments.key_quote: The devotee does not approach the Supreme for any material gain.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada discusses the five kinds of liberation and emphasizes pure devotion, which is devoid of any material or spiritual gain.

segments.key_quote: Nārāyaṇa is not anything of this material world.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains that Krishna, Vishnu, and Narayana are beyond the material world and that the term 'nirakara' means that God's form is not material.

segments.key_quote: When we become envious of Kṛṣṇa and we want to enjoy this material world, then we come to this material creation.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains that the material world is a result of envy towards Krishna and the desire to enjoy separately, leading to the cycle of karma and different forms of life.

segments.key_quote: He identified himself as the body.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada describes how everyone in the material world is attached to their body and identifies with it, which is what happened to Arjuna on the battlefield.

segments.key_quote: Anyone who is identifying himself with this material body, he is animal, go-kharā.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains that identifying oneself with the material body is animalistic and discusses how family affection drives economic development.

segments.key_quote: So Arjuna played the part of a gokhar.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada continues to describe the material attachments and explains that Arjuna played the part of someone identifying with the body, thus needing instruction.

segments.key_quote: We are presenting Bhagavad-gītā as it is. We do not change by our whimsical imagination, concoction.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada emphasizes presenting the Bhagavad-gita as it is, without misinterpretations, and asserts that the Mahabharata is a historical account of greater India.

segments.key_quote: Actually, the whole planet was Bhārata-varṣa.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains that the entire planet was once known as Bharata-varsha and was controlled by Vedic culture, which has since been lost.

segments.key_quote: He wanted that these Pāṇḍavas should be killed, and my sons, Kauravas, they should come out victorious, so that there will be no enemy.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains Dhritarashtra's anxiety and his desire for his sons to win the Kurukshetra battle, fearing a compromise.

segments.key_quote: Because he is devotee of Kṛṣṇa, therefore he felt, oh, what is this?
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains that the effect of the dharmakṣetra (holy place) was visible in Arjuna because he was a devotee, leading to his compassion and reluctance to fight.

segments.key_quote: The symptom of a devotee is they are unhappy by seeing others unhappy.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada describes the devotee's compassion for others' suffering and contrasts it with the envy prevalent in the material world.

segments.key_quote: Here in this material world, everything is false reality.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains that to understand the real truth, one must be non-envious and that the material world is a false reality.

segments.key_quote: And this is the basic principle of Bhagavad-gītā.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada concludes by stating that the Bhagavad-gita aims to help people get out of ignorance and enviousness.
